required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance of Withings Move ECG Software for Atrial Fibrillation Detection
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance of Withings Move ECG Software for Atrial Fibrillation Detection

brief_summary.textblock: Withings Move ECG watch is designed to record ECG and detect automatically atrial fibrillation. The aim of this study is to validate the performance of Move ECG watch to detect atrial fibrillation compared to a reference 12-lead ECG.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with atrial fibrillation are included in hospitals. On each patient, ECG with Move ECG and the reference 12-lead ECG are recorded simultaneously. Both records are then reviewed by independent cardiologists to assess
1. The presence or absence of atrial fibrillation
2. if waveforms of ECG recorded with Move ECG compared with the reference.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and Specificity of the automatic classification in AF by Move ECG single-lead ECG against reference 12-lead ECG
primary_outcome.description: sensitivity from the 2x2 confusion matrix AF vs 'non-AF'

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparability of ECG waveforms from single strip of Move ECG vs Lead-1 of reference 12-lead ECG
secondary_outcome.description: Visibility and polarity of P waves, QRS complex and T waves + length of QT interval, QRS width and PR interval + heart rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of use of Move ECG

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with AF during reference ECG
Patients diagnosed with SR during reference ECG

intervention.description: Simultaneous recording of a single-lead ECG signal with the Withings Move ECG and ECG signal for the reference 12-lead ECG

study_pop.textblock: in and out patients from cardiology services

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female who are 18 years or older
- Subject who signed the written informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vulnerable subject with regard to regulations
- Pregnant, parturient or breastfeeding woman,
- Subject who is deprived of liberty by judicial, medical or administrative decision,
- Underage subject,
- Legally protected subject, or subject who is unable to sign the written informed consent form,
- Subject who is not beneficiary or not affiliated to a social security scheme,
- Subject within several of the above categories,
- Subject who refused to participate in the study,
- Subject in physical incapacity to wear a wrist-worn watch
- Subject with electrical stimulation by pacemaker
